title: Hugo Corbalán
text:
Hugo Rolando Corbalán (born 8 November 1970 in <a href="San%20Miguel%20de%20Tucum%C3%A1n">San Miguel de Tucumán</a>) is a retired <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> defender who played 165 league games for <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Hurac%C3%A1n">Huracán</a> in the <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20Argentina">Primera División Argentina</a>.
Corbalán started his playing career in 1989 playing in the Argentine 2nd division with local club <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Tucum%C3%A1n">Atlético Tucumán</a>. In 1991, he signed with <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Hurac%C3%A1n">Huracán</a> where he went on to become a regular feature of the Racing team.
In 1998 Corbalán joined <a href="Racing%20Club%20de%20Avellaneda">Racing Club de Avellaneda</a> but he only made one league appearance for the club before returning to the lower divisions of Argentine football.
In 1999, he joined <a href="Independiente%20Rivadavia">Independiente Rivadavia</a> of the Argentine 2nd division, he then played for two of his home town clubs <a href="San%20Mart%C3%ADn%20de%20Tucum%C3%A1n">San Martín de Tucumán</a> and then a second stint with <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Tucum%C3%A1n">Atlético Tucumán</a>. His final club was Sportivo Villa Dolores of Catamarca in 2004.
